definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: The saint dinner table substituted for the sacrificial altar, choir's position has been ordinary is meeting audiences' right hand side.
sentences.chinese: 聖餐桌取代了祭壇，唱詩班的位置一般在會衆的右首。

sentences.english: Some light incense sticks at the several little altars all around the temple.
sentences.chinese: 幾個插滿了香燭的祭壇環繞在寺廟的四周。

sentences.english: And she saw her husband, the aged Priam, dragged towards the household altar and ruthlessly  butchered there.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的丈夫皮安姆被拖到家庭祭壇殘酷地處死。

sentences.english: The ground was covered with okra paint, enhancing the redness of theplace.
sentences.chinese: 地面鋪滿秋葵的圖案，加重了祭壇內部的紅色調。

sentences.english: The celebrant vested himself in the sanctuary.
sentences.chinese: 主持彌撒的神甫在祭壇上穿上祭袍。

sentences.english: At first, the altar was a white stone table, with red glaze on its top, representing the sun.
sentences.chinese: 最初祭壇爲白石方臺，壇面爲紅琉璃，象徵太陽。

sentences.english: He sits up on his back legs and puts his front paws together before the altar .
sentences.chinese: 牠會用後腿坐立在祭壇前，前腳合掌拜拜。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before the altar.
It’s lovely to find objects for your altar as you walk.
sentences.chinese: 當你漫步的時候爲祭壇找尋物件是令人愉悅的。

sentences.english: The Maccabees subsequently re-entered the temple and re-dedicated the altar of worship in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 馬加比後來再進入聖殿並且重新奉獻在殿中的祭壇。

sentences.english: Moses built an altar and called it The Lord is my Banner.
sentences.chinese: 摩西築了一座祭壇，給它起名叫“耶和華尼西”。

sentences.english: Standing at the foot of the altar, he suddenly turned ashen and collapsed to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他站在祭壇的底部，突然間變得臉色蒼白，倒在地上。

sentences.english: A freestanding crucifix and slender candlestick holder are shown standing to one side of the altar.
sentences.chinese: 一個獨立的十字架和細長的燭臺架展示在祭壇的一側。

sentences.english: Fire even came from the presence of the Lord and burned up the sacrifices on the altar.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有火從主面前出來，燒盡祭壇上的供物。

sentences.english: He was given the task of painting a picture of St Matthew for the alter of a church in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 當時他受命給羅馬一座教堂的祭壇畫一幅聖馬太的像。

sentences.english: And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
sentences.chinese: 亞多尼雅懼怕所羅門，就起來，去抓住祭壇的角。
